title: UK entrepreneur: the story of Will King
text: Will King’s first business venture was creating King of Shaves, a brand that became a household name when the market for men’s grooming products was very small. The company has been running for more than two decades and has brought innovation to both grooming and finance. In 2009, it issued the world’s first “mini-bond”, inspiring an alternative finance market, AltFi, whereby companies could obtain funding through crowdfunding and other methods - removing the need for a traditional bank loan. King stepped down as chief executive last year, handing over to his right-hand man Andy Hill, but remains the largest shareholder and adviser to the company. He now works extensively as a mentor for SMEs through his consultancy business, Entrepreneur in Residence. Last month, he co-founded ad agency Savage & King with his wife Tiger Savage, a creative director. King has been awarded an honorary doctorate from the University of Portsmouth, adding to accolades including becoming a fellow of University Campus Suffolk and the Royal Society of Arts. • Win a state-of-the-art Canon printer for your SME »
